intro: Gouldia hillebrandii f. eunodosa, commonly known as the pink gouldia, is a striking ornamental plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescences that range from pink to red. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is valued for its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological benefits, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
